column4: how can i install a program from its source file , i have ubuntu software center
but ubuntu software center cannot read pacakage files ?
open the package file in file-roller, it should offer to instal it
i extracted the tar.gz  , the extraction has a PackageSetup.py file and few folders
does it have a "README" or "INSTALL" file?
have you tried just running the .py file?
yes, a terminal might be helpful :)
how do i run a .py file ?

then i don't know. i'd have to find and read the install instructions, maybe you can find better ones. however, if you're new to ubuntu, rather try and find a binary package, then install that with help of file-roller.
ok one last question , what is a file-roller ?
i think the menu calls it "Archive Manager". in this usage, it is a program that provides an "Install" button when you give it a .deb package.
thanks very much for your help , i appriciate it
btw, if you happen to have a shell open, you can more simply install with just dpkg -i setup.de
that's why i suggested to look for a binary package. it should have .deb then.
